translation: Sutra on the Merit of Building Pagodas to Prolong Life

source_sentence: 罽賓國三藏沙門般若奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by Imperial Decree by the Tripiṭaka Master Prajñāpāramitā of the State of Kāśmīra
Thus I have heard.

source_sentence: 一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 與大苾芻眾及菩薩摩訶薩眾俱。
translation: He was accompanied by a large assembly of monks and a large assembly of bodhisattvas, the Mahāsattvas.

source_sentence: 爾時波斯匿王在大眾中。
translation: It was then that King Prasenajit was in the midst of the crowd.
He got up from his seat and adjusted his robes.
He bared his right shoulder and knelt on his right knee.
He bowed his head to the Buddha's feet, put his palms together, and paid homage.
He said to the Buddha.
"It's rare, Bhagavān.
"The Xiangzhi master told me.
'After seven days, I'll be gone.'
'My life span will surely end.'
I've been tormented by impermanence and suffering.
I have nowhere to turn for support and have come to the Bhagavān.
Please let the Bhagavān rescue me.
How can I be freed from sorrow and suffering?'
The Buddha told him.

source_sentence: 大王善自安慰勿得憂怖。
translation: "Great king, comfort yourself well and don't become sad and frightened.
The buddha-tathāgatas have good skillful means.

source_sentence: 能令大王獲殊勝利近延壽命。
translation: They can enable the great king to obtain excellent benefits and prolong his life.

source_sentence: 當得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: He will attain supreme, perfect enlightenment.
Listen closely, listen well, and consider it.
I will discern and explain it for you.
You should know, Your Majesty.

source_sentence: 若欲免離無常苦惱超入如來法身壽量。
translation: If you want to avoid the suffering and distress of impermanence and transcend the lifespan of the Tathāgata's Dharma body, you should first make a resolution to observe the Buddha's pure precepts.

source_sentence: 應先發心持佛淨戒修最上福。
translation: You should first arouse the intention to observe the Buddha's pure precepts and cultivate the highest merit.
Being able to summon this intention prolongs the king's life.'
The king said to the Buddha.
"Please grant me the Bhagavān's protection!

source_sentence: 所說發心持佛淨戒修最上福。
translation: That's the teaching about summoning the intention to uphold the Buddha's pure precepts and cultivate the highest virtue.

source_sentence: 我便奉行亦令國人奉行此法。
translation: I will then practice it and cause the people of my country to practice this teaching.
I don't know what kind of intention I've arisen.
What precepts should I uphold and what merit should I attain the most?
Please let the Tathāgata explain it for me.
The Buddha told the great king.
"Arouse the mind, and it's the four immeasurable mental states.
Those who say they'll observe precepts will observe the precept of not killing.
He who cultivates the highest virtue is no more than building a stūpa.
He'll have compassion for all sentient beings and aid them.
The gods and good spirits always come to guard them.
They don't part from each other like shadow and form.
That produces the great king's limitless benefits.

source_sentence: 大王建立佛塔福利難思。
translation: The benefits of the pagoda the great king built are unfathomable.
It's praised by the tathāgatas of the three times.
I'll briefly explain the causes and conditions for the king.
The king will listen closely.

source_sentence: 乃往古昔有一小兒此地牧牛。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a young boy who tended cattle here.

source_sentence: 有諸相師來共占相謂言。
translation: Some fortune tellers came to read his horoscope and said.

source_sentence: 此牧牛兒却後七日必當壽盡。
translation: 'Seven days after he leaves, this cowherd will surely reach the end of his life.'
At another time, that cowherd boy gathered with other small children to play in the sand.
He gathered sand with some small children and played with them.
One of the little ones destroyed the sand and turned it into a heap.
He said, "Let's build a stūpa that's one limb high.
It might be two, three, or four limbs high.

source_sentence: 時此小兒戲聚沙塔高一磔手。
translation: That little boy was playing with a pile of sand and a stūpa that was 1 jar high.
After he passes away, his life span is prolonged by seven years.
When he was piling up sand, there was a pratyekabuddha who carried a bowl and walked around.
There was a pratyekabuddha carrying a bowl and walking around.
Those little boys then, with playfulness in mind, handed over the sand and offered it to him, saying, "I'll give you some bread.
They offered the sand as alms, saying, "I'll give you some bread.
The pratyekabuddha then took the bowl and accepted it.
With supernatural powers, the sand transformed into bread.
Those little children then saw this as a cause and condition.
They all attained pure faith.

source_sentence: 時辟支佛與諸小兒悉授記莂作如是言。
translation: Pārśva then gave the children all the assurance of future enlightenment and said.

source_sentence: 汝諸童子所造之塔高一磔手者。
translation: 'The stūpa you boys build will be 1 jar high.
In a future life, he'll become an iron wheel-turning king.
He'll rule one world.
The one with two arms will become a copper wheel-turning king.
He'll be king of two worlds.
The third hand-span will become a silver wheel-turning king.
He'll be king of three worlds.
The fourth hand-span striker becomes a gold wheel-turning king.
He'll be king of four worlds.

source_sentence: 時諸小兒以嬉戲心造如是塔感如是果。
translation: Those little boys then built such a stūpa with a playful mind and received such a result.
How could it be possible for a great king to arouse a sincere intention?
Suppose there are good men and good women.
With a determined mind, they'll build a stūpa according to the teaching.

source_sentence: 乃至一肘量一磔手一指節一穬麥。
translation: That goes as far as measuring an elbow, limbering a hand, knuckling a finger, and driving a seed of wheat.
The merit that obtains has no limit.
There are always flowers raining down from the gods to offer support.
Therefore, Great King.

source_sentence: 若善男子善女人欲造塔時。
translation: When good sons and good women want to build a stūpa, they must first have great compassion for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 先於一切眾生起大悲心而為先導。
translation: First, they must give rise to the mind of great compassion for all sentient beings and make it the guide.
Use the mind of bodhi as the foundation.
Then, they purify the ground and build a stūpa for making offerings.

source_sentence: 以瞿摩夷塗之燒香散花。
translation: He coats it with gomaya, burns incense, and scatters flowers.
He sits facing due east and thinks.

source_sentence: 佛薄伽梵自利利他功德圓滿。
translation: "The Buddha Bhagavān has perfected the virtue of improving himself and bringing benefit to others.
He's also able to fulfill the vows of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我今成就第一法身發菩提心。
translation: Now, I've accomplished the first Dharma body and aroused the mind of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 於薄伽梵所有造塔軌儀法則。
translation: I will follow all the rules and regulations for building stūpas in the Blessed One.
One by one, I will orderly and correctly conduct myself according to the rules.
First, I gathered the marvelous flowers.
I'll bless it with a dhāraṇī seven times.
Scattering them on the altar, he offered them to the Tathāgata.
The dhāraṇī said.

source_sentence: 曩　謨　薩　怛他(二合)　耶　埵　阿　耨　羯　多　跛羅　底　瑟恥(二合)　帝　布　數波　罽　答迷　怛他　蘖　多　耶　三　藐　三　母　馱　耶　怛　儞也(二合)他　補　澁閉　補　澁閉(二合)　蘇　補　澁閉(二合)娑縛(二合)　賀(引)第二埏埴作泥團時。
translation: "An musā tantra (binary), a tattva, a hoe, a khado, a limpet, a tsehti (binary), a dibs, a khaṭṭṭā, a dharma, a tamā tamā tamā, a samyak samyak, a tamā nyi (binary), a tapu (binary), a sapu (binary), a sapu (binary), a sabhut (binary), a he (citation needed), and secondly, when he's making a lump of clay in a hutong.
He observes the word lithe.
'This is the Tathāgata's body of the Dharma realm.'
He should first take refuge in the life of the Tathāgata and say.

source_sentence: 曩　謨　捺　闍　溺　崛芻(二合)　悉底(二合)　耶　捺嚩(平)　薩　嚩　怛　他　蘖　多　難　滿　泥(上)　囉　怛曩(二合)　怛羅(二合)　演　輸　梵　阿　閦　鞞　阿　彌陀　畔　差(子阿反)　薄　伽　梵　阿　哩也(引)　嚩　嚕枳　帝　濕嚩(二合)　羅　耶　麌　嚕正埏埴時。
translation: 曩　謨　捺　闍　溺　崛芻(二合)　悉底(二合)　耶　捺嚩(平)　薩　嚩　怛　他　蘖　多　難　滿　泥(上)　囉　怛曩(二合)　怛羅(二合)　演　輸　梵　阿　閦　鞞　阿　彌陀　畔　差(子阿反)　薄　伽　梵　阿　哩也(引)　嚩　嚕枳　帝　濕嚩(二合)　羅　耶　麌　嚕正埏埴時。
He uses the dhāraṇī of kuṇḍa.
He blesses the clay twenty-one times.

source_sentence: 造一佛塔如造一俱胝佛塔。
translation: He builds a stūpa like he's building a kuṭī stūpa.
There's no difference in the merit obtained.

source_sentence: 是故此陀羅尼名為俱胝陀羅尼。
translation: This dhāraṇī is therefore called the kuṭī dhāraṇī.
The dhāraṇī says.

source_sentence: 怛　儞也(二合)　他　唵　蘇(上)佉澁茗(四合)　蘇佉澁茗(四合)蘇佉澁麼(四合)　阿　耨　羯　諦　訕　諦　訕諦　誕　諦　誕　諦　儞(平)　囉　拘　黎　曳(八)　戍嚩　提(九)　諦　主　嚩　提(十)　薩　嚩　母　馱(十一)　阿地　瑟姹(二合)　曩　阿　地　瑟恥(二合)　多　阿　母底　羝(十四)　娑嚩(二合引)　賀(引)第三次於泥團作娑頗(二合)字觀。
translation: 怛　儞也(二合)　他　唵　蘇(上)佉澁茗(四合)　蘇佉澁茗(四合)蘇佉澁麼(四合)　阿　耨　羯　諦　訕　諦　訕諦　誕　諦　誕　諦　儞(平)　囉　拘　黎　曳(八)　戍嚩　提(九)　諦　主　嚩　提(十)　薩　嚩　母　馱(十一)　阿地　瑟姹(二合)　曩　阿　地　瑟恥(二合)　多　阿　母底　羝(十四)　娑嚩(二合引)　賀(引)第三次於泥團作娑頗(二合)字觀。
You should observe that this clay ball is like a water essence.
It's also like a phāṭika jewel.
It's internally and externally pure, well-defined, and thoroughly penetrated.
He blesses it once with a dhāraṇī.
The dhāraṇī says.

source_sentence: 唵　嚩　日羅(二合)　嗢　多　皤　嚩　耶　娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)第四次塗赤土時。
translation: "When he paints red clay four times, he'll contemplate the color of fire.
He creates an observation of the color of fire.

source_sentence: 即知一切世間出世間法。
translation: He then knows that all mundane and transmundane dharmas are accomplished from tiny particles.
They all come from tiny particles and are accomplished.
After observing this, he takes dry red clay and rubs it all over a clay ball.
He takes dry red clay and rubs it all over a ball of clay.

source_sentence: 觀一切法本來無生畢竟空寂。
translation: He observes that all dharmas are originally unarisen and ultimately empty.
He makes a contemplation that includes words.
He imagines this lump of clay to be like melting gold.
Then, he builds a stūpa.
He used the dhāraṇī to bless it once.
The dhāraṇī says.

source_sentence: 唵　阿　羅　左　尾　羅　左　娑嚩(二合引)　賀第五次以泥團入模時。
translation: "Om Ārāḍa, Vīrāḍa, and Śaṭṭa (a two-component verse)." The fifth time, when he put the clay ball into the mold, he used the dhāraṇī to bless it once.
He used the dhāraṇī to bless it once.
Then, he puts it into the mold.
The dhāraṇī said.

source_sentence: 唵　嚩　日羅(二合引)　馱　都　蘖　陛　娑嚩(二合引)　賀(引)第六次入法身真言時。
translation: "Om vajra dhātu tiller hāva svāhāra(svāhāra) ha(citation needed) When he enters the mold the sixth time, he applies this dhāraṇī once.
He uses this dhāraṇī to invoke it once.
Then, he puts it into his seal.
The dhāraṇī says.

source_sentence: 唵　達　摩　馱　都　蘖　陛　娑嚩　賀(引)第七次椎打塔印時。
translation: "Om dharmadhātu tsukhā svāhā (citation needed)," and the seventh time he makes the stūpa seal, he uses the dhāraṇī to invoke it once.
He used the dhāraṇī to invoke it once.
Then, he strikes it with his hammer.
The dhāraṇī says.

source_sentence: 唵　嚩　日囉(二合引)　補　特　伽　羅　拘　吒　耶　拘吒耶娑嚩(二合引)　賀第八次椎打竟。
translation: "Om vajra (binary citation), pudgala, kuṭa, yakṣa, kuṭa, sāvarṇa (binary citation), and the eighth time he strikes it with the hammer.
When he makes the steps of the stūpa with his hands, he uses the dhāraṇī to bless it once.
He uses the dhāraṇī to bless it once.
He places it on the stūpa's steps.
The dhāraṇī says.

source_sentence: 唵　嚩　日羅(二合引)　喻　曬　娑嚩(二合引)　賀第九次塔正從模中出時。
translation: "Om, vajra, metaphor, sun, and sahāvaṃsana." He said the ninth time when the stūpa was correctly emerging from the mold, he applied the dhāraṇī once.
He used the dhāraṇī to bless it once.
Then, he exits it.
The dhāraṇī says.

source_sentence: 唵　達　摩　底　珠　娑嚩(二合引)　賀第十次脫塔出模已安置塔時。
translation: "Om Dharmadeva, 'Vasubandhu,' (verse in Sanskrit) goes out of the mold for the tenth time and places the stūpa in place after it comes out.
He used the dhāraṇī to bless it once.
The dhāraṇī said.

source_sentence: 唵　蘇　鉢羅(二合引)　底　瑟恥(二合)　多　嚩　日(入)羅(二合)娑嚩(二合)　賀(引)第十一次安置塔座了。
translation: "Om Supra (verse), Tiṣya (verse), Vajra (verse), Saṃsāra (verse), and He (verse) have placed the stūpa on its throne for the eleventh time.
He presses his hand against the top of the stūpa.
He repeated the dhāraṇī with an invocation.
The dhāraṇī said.

source_sentence: 唵　跛羅藍(三合)　摩　哆　喃　曳(平)　娑嚩(二合引)　賀(引)第十二次於塔上安傘蓋時。
translation: "Om Ṛṣamra (triad) mo ḍa Ṛan Ṛi (level) sahāva (diadem) hā (citation needed) The twelfth time, when he placed the canopy on the stūpa, he applied the dhāraṇī once.
He used the dhāraṇī to bless it once.
The dhāraṇī says.

source_sentence: 唵　跛羅藍(三合)　摩　婀　喻　曬　娑嚩(二合)　賀佛告大王。
translation: 唵　跛羅藍(三合)　摩　婀　喻　曬　娑嚩(二合)　賀佛告大王。
"Suppose good men and good women follow this guideline with a pure mind.

source_sentence: 以清淨心依此軌儀造作佛塔。
translation: With a pure heart, build a stūpa according to this guideline.
Whether they make one themselves or teach others to make one, they'll praise it or accept it with faith.
If they also praise it or if they believe in it, they'll accept it.

source_sentence: 所得功德與造佛塔等無差別。
translation: The merit attained is no different than that of building a stūpa.
You should know that person's whole life.
He won't be caught up in any poison.
His life will be long, and he'll have no untimely death.
At the end, he'll attain an indestructible body.
All demons and spirits won't dare to approach him.
The five stars and seven celestial bodies will follow and banish them.
All enemies will retreat.
Wherever they are born, their bodies will always be disease-free.
All sentient beings rejoice when they see it.
Those without pure precepts will have their pure precepts fulfilled.
Those who aren't disciplined are made to be disciplined.
Those who aren't purified are made purified.
When he breaks the precepts, the precepts are reborn.

source_sentence: 若犯四重及五無間極重罪業悉得消滅。
translation: If they violate the four grave and five unremittingly serious offenses, they'll all be extinguished.
All the hindrances and burdens from beginningless time will be ended.
If there's a woman who wants to meet a man.
She'll give birth to a man of courage, strength, and fortune.
The four great heavenly kings will always be there to support him.
The merit of building a stūpa will be like this.
If the stūpa breaks down, it turns into tiny dust.
When the wind blows, a speck of dust is scattered elsewhere.
Where that dust passes through mountains, forests, rivers, and seas, it's transported to other places.
All sentient beings who touch this dust will be forever free from the bodies of various things.
They'll never again be subject to a body of a different kind.
They'll always see the Buddha when they abandon their bodies and are born.
"Great king, suppose good men and good women.
Suppose you build a stūpa or a dhāraṇī.
They clearly perceive them and single-mindedly recall them.

source_sentence: 永離水難火難王難賊難。
translation: They'll be permanently spared the difficulties of water and fire, the difficulties of kings and thieves, and the difficulties of swords and armies.
Difficulties like knives and armies can't harm them.
Suppose he's in a wild or deserted place.
Suppose he were in a village or a large assembly.
He can proclaim this sūtra to the public.
That is, it will save the lives of sentient beings.
The amount of merit gained is equal to that of emptiness.
If it's written and circulated in later generations, then...

source_sentence: 塔雖未造造塔功德等無有異。
translation: Even though the stūpa has yet to be built, the merits of building it won't be different.

source_sentence: 我為大王及未來世一切眾生。
translation: For the great king and all sentient beings in future generations, I'll explain in detail the merits of building a stūpa to prolong life.
I'll explain in detail the merits of building a stūpa to prolong life.
The king will remember it.

source_sentence: 爾時波斯匿王及諸大眾。
translation: It was then that King Prasenajit and the general public rejoiced when they heard what the Buddha taught.

source_sentence: 聞佛所說皆大歡喜信受奉行。
translation: They all rejoiced when they heard what the Buddha taught and faithfully accepted and approved of it.
Sutra on the Merit of Building Pagodas to Prolong Life

source_sentence: 中天竺三藏牟尼室利　　　說梵語　　西明寺大德賜紫沙門圓照　筆　授　　章教寺大德沙門鑑虛　　　潤文靈雲校本云　貞享四丁卯稔中春二十三日一校了　　　　　　淨嚴(四十九載)
translation: The Tripiṭaka of Central India, Muniśrī, Speaks Sanskrit, Ximing Temple, the Great Deity Zhi Zi, the monk Yuanzhao, the author, Zhangjiao Temple, the Great Deity, the monk Jianxu, Ruenwen, Lingyun, proof text, Zaoheung 4, Dingmao, the 23rd day of the spring in the Nimble Medium, the first proof text, Jingyan (forty-nine years)
